reviews.review_msg: Nice guy but the driest lectures you could ever imagine. Miserably boring, slow-paced class with very little discussion. Tutorials are useless. Exams are unreasonable (2 essays in 1 hour) and there's a huge term paper. Also get ready to be buried under boring long readings all semester and not be instructed. Would not recommend this class with him.
Dry, boring lectures with long boring, readings. Would not recommend this class.

He is a nice man , I feel bad saying this but as a proff he is not good! he speaks in a low voice which makes you sleepy and the material are not quite clear. I still got a good mark so I think he is an easy marker but his lectures were so borringggg its was like torture

He has a very quiet voice that would put me asleep at 8:30am. He would only cover 2-8 slides in 2hrs. I attended every lecture before the midterm and did horrible. I didn't attend any after and just did my readings and I did better.

His lectures are very dry, but it relates well to the readings. I wouldn't recommend buying the custom courseware at SFU bookstore, because they are available in cheaper prices online from previous students. His midterms are outrageous, 1 hour to write 2 essays, and no essay question preparation beforehand. Only recommend it if it is compulsory!

Mr. Froschauer specializes in sociological issues in Canada and is familiar with the course material. If you can listen through his lullaby of a voice, you'll learn a lot from his detailed examples. There is a lot of readings, but it's all relevant. Don't buy the pricey custom courseware, most of the articles are in the library (books & databases).
Really nice guy and easy course requirements (don't know how this counts as a W). He was kind of a rambler and not particularly engaging.
not bad. really boring guy, but do the readings and you would get an A

This class was extremely dry, even for the interesting content. Whether it was because it was at 8:30 in the morning, or because of his deep monotone voice repeating things we already read, neither I nor anyone else around me enjoyed this class. That being said, it's a good GPA booster if you do the readings. Take your pick: GPA booster v. boredom.

Class was super chill. Take the tutorial with prof.froschauer!!!! basically you read come up with questions and discuss them in tutorial. Mid terms and finals are easy if you do the readings and use the sub-headings. im first year and i found this to be a great course for the transistion from high school to uni

This course was required for my degree and I did not want to take it; however the material was suprisingly interesting. He's a really nice professor (he was my tutorial leader also) and basically summarizes the text for you in class. So if you don't want to read you have to go to class. If you read the articles tutorials will be easy.

BEST professor ive had at SFU so far! His exams are easy. He takes the key headings from the text, and you can bs your way through it. Tutorials were pointless, but overall best class ive ever had (and trust me, I dont have the best GPA, but I got an A in this class). I strongly recommend this for a first year student or easy elective ;)

Great prof to take for an early sociology class. His explanations of complicated concepts are accessable and his lectures detailed. Can sometimes go on tangents, but if you're a proficient note-taker, there's no way to fail this class.

Super easy course and she's a great prof! lots of writing and reading but it is a W course, she definitely cares about her students and is always down to help and is super understanding. she replies super quickly thru email too! you don't really need to attend lectures but definitely keep up with the course schedule if you don't attend

For the mid term, the expectations were not clear at all. She expected so much more for every answer than what the question asked so make sure you write more than you think you need. Pretty boring class, she seemed to care but was couldn't get the class engaged at all. Discussion questions every week and lots of readings.

She's great! it's an online course for me and she canceled discussion posts if she thought we were being overwhelmed. 2 papers both 500-600 words. She provided all the articles on the SFU library reserve. A small media presentation was super easy. Fair marker. The midterm was written and you have to have read the articles and watched the films.

Had to take this class online and I would like to believe that is why the class was so difficult. It's a 100 level class and she still decided to make it hard to understand her or her assignments. All topics are super vague and she's never specific in what she wants. Kinda wish I never took the course!

This professor is a bit dry but that's not the biggest problem with her. She refuses to help and try to put everything on the ta and her ta nadira is not helpful and seem like she hates everyone when she teaches. Deborah's test are not fair . She will ask you for an example and expect you to explain everything but she didn't specify it. Overall bad

For a writing course, I found it to be surprisingly easy. 4 papers in total; the longest were merely 600 words max. Course concepts are straightforward, but lectures were dull as she read mostly off of the slides. Tutorial readings were challenging at times but she was quite good with clarification. Final was a breeze with no surprises at all.

The class itself could be better if she explained the content in an easier way to understand. For a first year class it's quite difficult. Her PowerPoints don't have much information on it so its hard to grasp concepts and there's no textbooks for clarification. She's a very critical marker so make sure your writing is clear and concise

Benita is a great prof. This course had a lot of important lecture content and I learned a lot. If you're racist, bigoted or rooted in your white/cis/male privilege you probably won't like her, but you'll sure learn something about the world. She challenges you to work harder and think deeper. Not as easy as I would expect for a 100-level course.
Took this class distance ed and Rachel was the TA. Not very helpfulclear with expectations, feedback wasn't too great on the two papers.
